wiki.content:
Peter Tosh stood strong for peace and freedom.  He believed that all people were entitled to live in peace without judgement, hassling, and religious persecution. This song waves the peter tosh flag in a big way.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: Peter Tosh stood strong for peace and freedom.  He believed that all people were entitled to live in peace without judgement, hassling, and religious persecution. This song waves the peter tosh flag in a big way.

track.name: Equal Rights
comments: For truly, there is no peace on earth,for it's the devil's realm.  There is no justice, only the dream of. Only in the life after will there be peace.
equal rights and justice is what it is all about

" Everybody want to go up to heaven but nobody want to die." A priceless insight found in a great reggae song about equality. "Everybody fighting to reach the top but how far is the bottom?" And his insights about apathy continue through the whole song. Brilliant work by Tosh!!!
Reggae ist ein Gefühl.. Peter einer der Besten
Don't we all. I also want a big spaceship so I can travel the stars and leave this insane world and its complications behind.
A shout out to dreadlock Molly for turning me onto Peter Tosh and Bob Marley.   Love it!
